[ Obsolete | The ECLiPSe Built-In Predicates | Reference Manual | Alphabetic Index ]

schedule_woken(+SuspList, +Priority)

Schedule all suspensions in the suspension list SuspList with the priority Priority.
+SuspList
Suspension list or difference list or variable
+Priority
Integer

This built-in predicate is obsolete!

Description

This predicate is used to override the priority of all sleeping suspensions in SuspList and to schedule them with a new priority Priority.

One possible use of this predicate is to postpone the execution of all suspensions in a list when they are known to succeed, to make sure that there will be no floundering goals and that the predicates are not executed too soon. This is the case e.g. when a variable is instantiated but this change should not be propagated to related constraints, because it is known to be redundant.

Fail Conditions

None.

Resatisfiable

No.

Exceptions

(4) instantiation fault
Priority is not instantiated.
(5) type error
SuspList is not a list nor a difference list nor free.
(5) type error
Priority is not an integer.
(6) out of range
Priority is less than 1 or greater than 255.

Examples

[eclipse 1]: make_suspension(writeln(hello), 4, S),
             make_suspension(writeln('hi there'), 2, T),
             schedule_woken([S, T]), wake.
hi there
hello

S = 'WOKEN GOAL'
T = 'WOKEN GOAL'
yes.
[eclipse 2]: make_suspension(writeln(hello), 4, S),
             make_suspension(writeln('hi there'), 2, T),
             schedule_woken([S, T], 6), wake.
hello
hi there

S = 'WOKEN GOAL'
T = 'WOKEN GOAL'
yes.

See Also

schedule_woken / 1, insert_suspension / 3, insert_suspension / 4, make_suspension / 3, suspension_to_goal / 3, wake / 0
